Package com.nickbenn.onehundred.strategy

Abstract and concrete classes declaring and implementing computer strategies for playing the game.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    OptimalStrategy
    Implements an optimal strategy for the normal (non-misère) form of the One Hundred game.
    RandomStrategy
    Implements a random strategy for the normal (non-misère) form of the One Hundred game.
    Strategy
    Declares the abstract method Strategy.getNextMove(Game) (which must be implemented in a concrete subclass), as well as the concrete method Strategy.getRng() (providing a source of randomness to a concrete implementation), along with the overloaded Strategy.newInstance(String) and Strategy.newInstance(String, Random) static factory methods.
  • Exception Summary 
    Exception Description
    Strategy.StrategyInitializationException
    Encapsulates an unchecked exception, thrown when instantiation of a concrete subclass of Strategy fails, for any reason.
